This article is about the jarred impling. For the creature, see Ninja impling.

Item ID11254

A ninja impling jar is obtained as the result of successfully catching a Ninja impling, while also having an empty impling jar in your inventory. A Hunter level of 74 is required to catch ninja implings.

This jar can be traded in singularly to Elnock Inquisitor for 3 empty impling jars, but this is not recommended due to its high value.

Contents

  • 1 Loot
    • 1.1 Impling jar
    • 1.2 Main drops
    • 1.3 Tertiary
  • 2 Changes
  • 3 References

Loot[edit | edit source]

At current Grand Exchange prices, opening a ninja impling jar gives 14,436 worth of loot, on average. This means opening ninja impling jars marks an average profit of −26,984 per jar, however this does not include loot from clue scrolls.

On average, one would profit −674,610 to get a hard clue scroll from ninja impling jars at current Grand Exchange prices, excluding the rewards from the completed Treasure Trails.

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

Impling jar[edit | edit source]

An empty impling jar is returned when removing the loot, with a 10% chance of it breaking.[1]

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
21 April 2016
(update | poll)

Hard clue scrolls have been added to ninja impling drop tables.

5 March 2015
(update)

The item was made tradeable on the Grand Exchange.
